title: About
text: I am Lindsay McMullen! I am from Morton, IL. I am currently a senior sports media & communications major at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln graduating in December 2025. I have a Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education and History from Bradley University. ​​​​​​​I have a background in high school education, corporate, sports, and hospitality. I can offer a wide variety of skills through my communication, leadership, attention to detail, and organization.

title: Who is the true volleyball Power Conference?
text:
The Big Ten historically has been known as the power conference of women’s volleyball, but lately that has become more of a conversation. With No. 3 Texas joining the SEC along with No. 2 Kentucky, spectators think SEC deserves the title. What people don’t realize is the Pac-12 should’ve been considered the power conference with the most national championships.


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(patchwork)
library(ggbump)

nc <- read_csv("TotalNationalChampionships.csv")
pc <- read_csv("VolleyballData.csv")
views <- read_csv("Views.csv")

conf <- pc |> 
  group_by(conference) |> 
  summarize(
    opponent_total_attacks = mean(opponent_hit_pct),
    total_attacks = mean(hit_pct)
  ) 

big10 <- pc |> filter(conference == "Big Ten")
acc <- pc |> filter(conference == "ACC")

bar1 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=pc, aes(x=reorder(conference, hit_pct), weight=hit_pct), fill="#000000") + 
  geom_bar(data=acc, aes(x=reorder(conference, hit_pct), weight=hit_pct), fill="#013CA6") + 
  coord_flip() + 
  labs( 
    x="", 
    y="Average Hitting Percentage"
    ) + 
  theme_minimal() 

bar2 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=pc, aes(x=reorder(conference, opponent_hit_pct), weight=opponent_hit_pct), fill="#000000") + 
  geom_bar(data=big10, aes(x=reorder(conference, opponent_hit_pct), weight=opponent_hit_pct), fill="#0088CE") +
  coord_flip() + 
  labs( 
    x="", 
    y="Average Opponent Hitting Percentage"
    ) + 
  theme_minimal() 

bar1 + bar2 + 
  plot_annotation( 
    title = "What Conferene has the best hitting percentage and holding opponent percentage over the past 5 years?",
    subtitle = "These charts share the conference average hitting percentage and opponent hitting percentage",
    caption = "Source: NCAA | By Lindsay McMullen "
  )  & 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )









The main


Code
movers <- c("Oklahoma", "Texas", "UCLA", "Southern California", "Oregon", "Washington", "Stanford", "Arizona", "Arizona State", "Colorado", "California")

movingteams <- pc |> filter(team %in% movers)

ggplot() + 
  geom_bump(data=movingteams, aes(x=season, y=team, color=conference)) + 
  geom_point(data=movingteams, aes(x=season, y=team, color=conference), size = 2) + 
  scale_color_manual(values = c(
    "#013CA6", #ACC 
    "#C41230", #Big 12 
    "#0088CE", #Big Ten 
    "#092346", #Pac-12
    "#FBCE28" # SEC 
    )) + 
  labs(
    title="Power 5 Conference realignment over the past 5 years", 
    subtitle="The power 5 has seen a shift in conference alignment and removal over the past 5 years", 
    y= "", 
    x = "Season",
    caption = "Source: NCAA | By Lindsay McMullen", 
    color="Conference") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 









Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words.
Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words.


Code
Big10 <- nc |> 
  filter(
    Conference == "Big 10"
  )

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=nc, aes(x=reorder(Conference, Total), weight= Total)) + 
  geom_bar(data=Big10, aes(x=reorder(Conference, Total), weight= Total), fill = "#0088CE") +
  labs(
    title="What Conference has the most National Championships? ", 
    subtitle="The Pac-12 leads the Power 5 conferences with the most national championships", 
    y= "", 
    x = "Conference",
    caption = "Source: NCAA | By Lindsay McMullen", 
    color="Conference") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 









Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words. Words words words words words.


Code
Big10 <- views |> filter(Conference == "Big 10")

ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data=views, aes(x=Season, y=Viewership), color="red") + 
  geom_line(data=Big10, aes(x=Season, y=Viewership), color="#0088CE") +
 
  labs(
    title="National Championship viewer increase in National Championship Games", 
    subtitle="There has been a spike in vieweership when a Big 10 team is present in the national championship", 
    y= "Viewers (Millions)", 
    x = "Season",
    caption = "Source: NCAA | By Lindsay McMullen", 
    color="Conference") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  )
